{"step_by_step_thinking": "Metformin is a commonly used medication for the treatment of type 2 diabetes. Let's evaluate each option to determine which one is not true about metformin.

B. Excreted unchanged in urine: This statement is true. Metformin is primarily excreted unchanged in the urine, with approximately 90% of the drug being eliminated this way.

C. Reduce hepatic glucose production: This statement is true. One of the main mechanisms of action of metformin is to reduce hepatic glucose production by inhibiting gluconeogenesis.
